content.description:
Wango is a spicy and fun pitch.

Start at a left-leaning, flared crack that leads to a dike. Climb the dike and clip a bolt. Head left and jam through a roof to a blind jug. This is not an intro 5.10.
content.protection:
Tricky gear. Rack to a #2. I used two #0.3s.

It has a manky nut/ hex anchor at the top that could use a new sling/ cordellette.
content.location: This is climber's left and below all other climbs on this wall.

content.description: Follow a right-leaning hand crack to a ledge with a bolt anchor.  The crux is right off the ground.
content.location:
This is the first crack to the right of

Tomb Raider

.

content.description:
Start up a low angle slab and gain a right-facing flake system.  Follow this to the obvious horizontal crack below the summit.  Traverse to the right passing an old pin.

Some of the rock is a little flakey, so watch your step.
content.location:
Missing Tooth climbs the small spire to the left of

Tomb Raider

....

content.description:
It can be climbed in three short pitches.

P1 (5.9). Clip a bolt, then follow a left-leaning crack.

P2 (5.7). Traverse left, and climb over a roof on good holds.

P3 (5.10b/c). Climb a vertical arete to a left-traversing arete to gain the summit of pyramid-shaped rock.
content.protection: Traditional gear is needed for the first 2 pitches. The 3rd pitch has 3 bolts. All anchors are bolted.
content.location: There is a "V" of two crack on the south side of Wango's Workshop. It is the left one with a bolt at just off the ground. You can rap to the ground from the 2nd anchor with a 60m rope.
